meanings.definition: To sharpen (a blade or tool) by grinding or friction.
meanings.sent1: I used a stone to whet the knife before cutting the vegetables.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith would often whet his tools before starting his work.
meanings.sent3: The chef playfully challenged his apprentice to whet the dull knife in record time.
meanings.sent4: Her curiosity was whetted by the mysterious package left on her doorstep.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the blade being whetted against the stone echoed through the workshop.

meanings.definition: To stimulate or excite (someone's desire or interest).
meanings.sent1: The enticing aroma of freshly baked cookies whetted my appetite.
meanings.sent2: The movie trailer was designed to whet the audience's anticipation for the film.
meanings.sent3: The magician's tricks never failed to whet the children's sense of wonder.
meanings.sent4: The challenge of the escape room game whetted their competitive spirits.
meanings.sent5: The first chapter of the book was a teaser meant to whet the reader's curiosity.
